column4: Alright guys I've tried everything from reinstall xinit and xorg, to purging, to reinstalling lightdm and gnome shell. Long story short, My setuid bit got screwed up and turned off on all the files in my system. So I tried to undo it, now I have some files that require a setuid, and some that are saying I shouldnt have it.
What did you do to unset the setuid on all files on your system?
That screwed up your system. Hopefully you have a backup handy.
WE do not have a backup of YOUR system :)
